channel.title: Skillcape Animations
channel.description:
I know this has been posted many times before, I searched for it but I never found an answer to the questions. How do you add a skillcape animation? Im talking about just a little square, like on runescape, so that only one box sais "Skillcape" on it and when you click it it does the animation for the skillcape you are wearing, and when you click it and your not wearing a skillcape, a message comes up and sais "You must be wearing a skillcape to do this emote!"
What I want to know is what folder(s) I need to edit to add the emote, what to add in the file, etc.

item.title: Skillcape Animations
item.dc:creator: @iwolfi iwolfi
item.description:
@iwolfi wrote:

so did you… u bumped it even more.

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcape Animations
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

[quote=“iwolfi, post:23, topic:160308”]im a noob coder but i need to know were to add this
Quote from: Thrasher Alpha on November 24, 2007, 02:18:08 PM
Code:

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10708)

{
boolean GoOn = true;
startAnimation(2720);
stillgfx(601, absY, absX);
stillgfx(601, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Skillcape!”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
abc = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14000000]);
cba = abc / 10;
abc2 = cba * 2;
if (abc2 <= 1) {
abc2 = 2;
}
playerLevel[99] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14000000]);
playerLevel[99] += abc2;
sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[99]+"", 4006);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
GoOn = false;
}

Is that a good code to add?
help plz?[/quote]

Your mother must be so proud…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Green_U wrote:

[quote=“Thrasher Alpha, post:12, topic:160308”][code]if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10708)

{
boolean GoOn = true;
startAnimation(2720);
stillgfx(601, absY, absX);
stillgfx(601, absY, absX);
txt4 = “Skillcape!”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
abc = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14000000]);
cba = abc / 10;
abc2 = cba * 2;
if (abc2 <= 1) {
abc2 = 2;
}
playerLevel[99] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14000000]);
playerLevel[99] += abc2;
sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[99]+"", 4006);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
GoOn = false;
}[/code]

Is that a good code to add?[/quote]

That is a discrace, The real way to add it is to replace one of the current emotes with the new ones.Thats how it done.

item.title: Skillcape Animations
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

heres what i did

this line adds the “skill” text on the 2nd line, 1st column.

sendFrame126("@whi@skill", 181);

this case is the button’s case and sends it to the correct void.

case 169: // skill capes capeEmote(); break;

Put this with the other voids.

[code]public void capeEmote()
{
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10704 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10705) { //Attack
setAnimation(2890);
stillgfx(441, absY, absX);
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10707 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10708) { //Strength

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10710 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10711) { //Defence

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10713 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10714) { //Ranging

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10716 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10717) { //Prayer

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10719 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10720) { //Magic
setAnimation(725);
stillgfx(370, absY, absX);

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10722 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10723) { //Runecraft

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10725 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10726) { //Hitpoints

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10728 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10729) { //Agility
setAnimation(1110);
stillgfx(61, absY, absX);
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10731 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10732) { //Herblore

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10734 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10735) { //thieving

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10737 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10738) { //Crafting

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10740 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10741) { //Fletching

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10743 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10744) { //slayer

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10746 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10747) { //Construction

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10749 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10750) { //Mining

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10752 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10753) { //Smithing

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10755 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10756) { //fishing

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10758 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10759) { //Cooking

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10761 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10762) { //firemaking

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10764 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10765) { //woodcutting

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10767 || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10768) { //Farming

}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 10770) { //quest point cape

}
}[/code]
i’ve only added a few emotes so far to my server.

and not quite sure but you might need to add this to your item.cfg

item = 10704 Attack_cape Attack_cape 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10705 Attack_cape(t) Attack_cape(t) 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10706 Attack_Hood Attack_hood 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10707 Strength_cape Strength_cape 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10708 Strength_cape(t) Strength_cape(t) 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10709 Strength_hood Strength_hood 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10710 Defence_cape Defence_cape 99000 33000 33000 0 0 0 0 0 9 9 9 9 9 0 0 item = 10711 item.description:
@si_force wrote:

this is possible,i have it on my server,there not the animations like on real runescape though,
different ones

capeEmote();
    break;

item.title: Skillcape Animations
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

  1. Not really, you’ll probably mess up alot (There are ALOT of effect id’s out there that dont work) but with the animation ids, try to find a list. I used to have one, but while I was rummaging through my files I accidentally deleted it. 2) Edit client.java. Remember, search for the emote case and delete whatever is under it and replace the code with that =P

Edit: And btw, that wasn’t 1 thing, that was 2. I deserve rep! REP I TELL YOU!!! Cries

Read full topic

[quote=“Miss_Doctor, post:5, topic:160308”]this is just code for the animation… [code]if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == CAPEIDHERE)

{
boolean GoOn = true;
startAnimation(ANIMATIONNUMBERHERE);
stillgfx(EFFECTIDHERE, absY, absX);
stillgfx(EFFECTIDHERE, absY, absX);
txt4 = “MESSAGE HERE”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
abc = getLevelForXP(playerXP[SKILLNUMBERHERE]);
cba = abc / 10;
abc2 = cba * 2;
if (abc2 <= 1) {
abc2 = 2;
}
playerLevel[SKILLNUMHERE] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[SKILLNUMBHERE]);
playerLevel[SKILLNUMBHERE] += abc2;
sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[SKILLNUMBERHERE]+"", 4006);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
GoOn = false;
}[/code]

Ignore the delete item, thats for my own code ;P[/quote]

item.title: Skillcape Animations
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

this is just code for the animation… Im not sure at all how to add the emote square thing, if that’s even possible. Just make it so that if you’re wearing the cape you can do it. [code]if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == CAPEIDHERE)

{
boolean GoOn = true;
startAnimation(ANIMATIONNUMBERHERE);
stillgfx(EFFECTIDHERE, absY, absX);
stillgfx(EFFECTIDHERE, absY, absX);
txt4 = “MESSAGE HERE”;
string4UpdateRequired = true;
abc = getLevelForXP(playerXP[SKILLNUMBERHERE]);
cba = abc / 10;
abc2 = cba * 2;
if (abc2 <= 1) {
abc2 = 2;
}
playerLevel[SKILLNUMHERE] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[SKILLNUMBHERE]);
playerLevel[SKILLNUMBHERE] += abc2;
sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[SKILLNUMBERHERE]+"", 4006);
deleteItem(161, GetItemSlot(161), 1);
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
GoOn = false;
}[/code]

Ignore the delete item, thats for my own code

Oh, and you add this under the case of the emote button.

Read full topic
